p: Chrysin (5,7-dihydroxyflavone, also known as vitamin P) (Fig. 13) is a bioflavonoid compound found in high concentrations in propolis, honeym passion fruit, flowers, mushrooms, carrot, chamomile and some medicinal plants such as Radix scutellariae, Lactariusdeliciosus ( L. ex Fr.)S.F. Gray, Passiflora incarnate L., S. ramosissima M. Pop, Cytisusmultiflorus ( L’Her. Ex Aiton) Sweet, Scutellaria immaculate Nevski ex Juz, and Passifloracoerulea L. Desmoscochinchinensis Lour.
